alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:15AM CDT until August 22 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...A band of thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, southeastern Haskell, northern Shackelford and southwestern Throckmorton. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 AM CDT, National Weather Service radar indicated very heavy rain with a band of thunderstorms, moving to the southeast. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Haskell, North Central Shackelford and Southwestern Throckmorton Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
